posts.name: Big Al's Diner
posts.note: Big Al's Diner is a compact diner is dishing up generous portions of breakfast all day and hearty American fare at lunch. When I was at Big Al's Diner, I ordered the cheese omelette with rye toast and corned beef hash. It was a huge plate of food.
posts.cptn: Cheese omelette, rye toast, and corned beef hash at Big Al's Diner in Cleveland, Ohio

posts.name: Crop Bistro & Bar
posts.note: Crop Bistro and Bar is a bank turned sleek, upscale New American eatery with a chef's table and a focus on local ingredients.

posts.name: Frank's Bratwurst
posts.note: Frank's Bratwurst has been serving bratwurst that is like no other, derived from a secret recipe that has gone through rigorous research and development. Franks' Bratwurst makes some of the best bratwurst sandwiches and other sausages too. You need to order a few different kinds with friends so you can try them all.

posts.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
posts.note: Great Lakes Brewing Company is an iconic microbrewery with house suds, an updated American menu, free tours and a patio.

posts.name: The Greenhouse Tavern
posts.note: The Greenhouse Tavern is a hip haunt with locally driven New American fare, a rooftop patio, and creative cocktails.

posts.name: Happy Dog East
posts.note: Happy Dog East serves quarter-pound hot dogs with creative toppings plus live music and 75+ tap beers in a convivial space. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Hot Sauce Williams
posts.note: Hot Sauce Williams is a family-friendly barbecue joint is known for its Polish Boy sandwich, fried chicken and mac 'n' cheese.

posts.name: Le Bistro Du Beaujolais
posts.note: Le Bistro Du Beaujolais is a quaint French bistro in a circa-1830 home with patio seats, fixed-price options, and French-only wines.

posts.name: Le Petit Triangle Café
posts.note: Le Petit Triangle Café is a Parisian offering for morning coffee and pastries, along with casual midday meals and evening wine dinners. I ordered a great croissant ham, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich. My friend ordered the escargots with parsley-garlic butter and sliced baguette.

posts.name: Lola Bistro
posts.note: Michael Symon's Lola Bistro serves New American eatery serves rustic fare in a sleek, bustling setting.

posts.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
posts.note: Each batch of Mitchell's Ice Cream is hand-crafted in our Ohio City Kitchen (watch them anytime). Ingredients that grow well in our Ohio climate they get from friends around here. Ingredients that grow best in different climates they get from the world's best producers. They do a lot of searching, and they're never be done.

posts.name: Sokolowski's University Inn
posts.note: Sokolowski's University Inn is a family-owned landmark serves cafeteria-style Polish classics in homey surroundings.

posts.name: Steve's Gyro's
posts.note: If you’re craving a gyro, Steve's Gyro's asks that you arrive early. Steve's Gyro's do sell out early every day, and because of that, they do close earlier than scheduled Market hours. I liked it so much I went back the next day to get one to have for lunch for the road trip home to DC.

posts.name: Slyman's Restaurant
posts.note: Slyman's Restaurant is a retro breakfast and lunch deli known for corned beef sandwiches served in simple diner digs.

posts.name: TownHall
posts.note: TownHall is a locally sourced and innovative bar bites, and vegan options served in a contemporary setting with patio. TownHall is located about a block or so from the Westside Market.

posts.name: Trentina
posts.note: Trentina is the sixth restaurant from James Beard Award-winning Chef Jonathon Sawyer and his wife, Amelia Sawyer which provides an intimate and eclectic dining experience with a menu of Northern Italian cuisine and wine. The restaurant pays homage to the foodways of Trentino, Italy, where Amelia and her family originate. If you get a chance and have the means, you should eat their eleven-course tasting menu which gives you a little bit of everything Northern Italian cuisine. The wine/drinks pairing was great too if you are into to that.

posts.name: West Side Market
posts.note: West Side Market is a grand, bustling public market from 1912 featuring vendors for meat, produce, bread and hot food.

posts.name: West Side Market Cafe
posts.note: The West Side Market Cafe is a casual eatery in the historic market, dishing up down-home American eats for breakfast and lunch. I ended up ordering an omelette with home fries, rye toast, and a side sausage.
